summary: This document is an email chain from May 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and a law firm partner regarding the preparation and production of discovery materials, including photographs, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team. It references prior FBI custody of original photographs and includes a snippet from an FBI 302 report.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: She is the sender of a key email providing information about photographs produced in a civil case, their origins, and their custody history with the FBI.

events.title: FBI Visit to Residence for Evidence Collection
events.description: An FBI Special Agent (SA) traveled to a residence where a witness provided a massage school certification and photographs. ED-597 Receipts for Property were executed.
personsInvolved: Unnamed witness (likely a victim or associate)

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel prepare and send a zip file of discovery materials, including a cover letter, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel.

keyFacts: The email chain coordinates the production of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team in May 2021.
Sigrid McCawley of Boies Schiller Flexner LLP provides background on photographs, stating the originals were taken into custody by the FBI and are not held by her firm.
A clipped FBI 302 report from March 18, 2011, describes an FBI agent traveling to a residence to collect evidence, including photographs and a massage school certification.
The document indicates that some evidence (photographs) had both civil case Bates numbers and FBI Bates numbers, showing crossover between civil and criminal investigations.
Multiple email addresses are redacted, showing communication between the U.S. Attorney's Office and external legal counsel regarding sensitive case materials.
